conversation_context.content: Hey there! I just finished grading those quizzes and... honestly, I'm a bit worried about you.
dont worry about me bro, I'm okay, I'm just stress out lately but I can handle it

I hear you, but... look, I’m not trying to be dramatic, but those last two scores (35 and 28) aren’t just “rough week” territory—they’re putting you in real danger of failing the whole course. I care about you, and I don’t want to see you have to retake this class next semester. 

What’s been eating up your time lately? Is it work, family stuff, mental health, or are the concepts just not clicking? Let’s figure out a plan together—office hours, study group, lighter load next term—whatever it takes.
its just family stuff but I'm sorting things out and thank you for worrying about me

I’m really glad you’re sorting it—family stuff can hit hard. Still, the clock’s ticking: midterm’s two weeks away and it’s 30% of your grade. If that score stays in the 20s-30’s range, the math gets ugly fast.

Can you carve out, like, an hour a day just for CS this week? Swing by my office hours tomorrow (3-5), or if that’s impossible, text me a time that works and I’ll shift stuff around. We’ll laser-focus on the stuff you missed on the quizzes—linked-lists, basic Big-O—so you’re not drowning in the whole textbook. You don’t have to ace it; you just need to pull a 60-ish on the midterm to stay alive. I’ve got review packets and past exams ready; let’s slam through them together.
